question: Which statement is correct when considering the right to privacy under Article 8 of the European Convention on Human Rights (ECHR)?
options: The right to privacy is an absolute right
The right to privacy has to be balanced against other rights under the ECHR
The right to freedom of expression under Article 10 of the ECHR will always override the right to privacy
The right to privacy protects the right to hold opinions and to receive and impart ideas without interference
explanation:
《欧洲人权公约》第8条保护私人和家庭生活、住宅和通信受到尊重的权利。然而，这项 权利并不是绝对的，公共当局可以根据法律并出于合法目的对其进行限制。欧洲人权法院
(ECHR) 制定了一项丙阶段测试，以确定此类限制是否合理。首先，法院必须审查公共 当局所追求的合法目的，例如国家安全、公共安全或预防犯罪。其次，法院必须评估公共 当局为实现这一目标而使用的手段是否适当和必要。这一目标，同时考虑到所有相关因素， 例如相称性、必要性和限制性较小的替代方案。因此，隐私权不是一项绝对权利，而是一 项有条件的权利，必须与《欧洲人权公约》规定的其他权利相平衡。
legalReference:
European Convention on Human Rights - Article 8

Article 8 - Right to respect for private and family life

1. Everyone has the right to respect for his private and family life, his home and his correspondence.

2. There shall be no interference by a public authority with the exercise of this right except such as is in accordance with the law and is necessary in a democratic society in the interests of national security, public safety, economic well-being, prevention of disorder or crime, protection of health or morals, or protection of rights and freedoms of others.

The right to privacy under Article 8 is NOT absolute - it must be balanced against other rights through a three-stage test: legitimate aim, necessary measures, proportionality.

question: A key component of the OECD Guidelines is the“Individual Participation Principle”.What parts of the General Data Protection Regulation(GDPR) provide the closest equivalent to that principle?
options: The lawful processing criteria stipulated by Articles 6 to 9
The information requirements set out in Articles 13 and 14
The breach notification requirements specified in Articles 33 and 34
The rights granted to data subjects under Articles 12 to 22
explanation: OECD 的“个人参与原则”强调了个人对自己数据的控制权和参与权。GDPR 中的第12至22 条赋予数据主体权利，包括接收、更正或删除其个人数据的权利，最直接地体现了这一原 则。

question: What is an important difference between the European Court of Human Rights (ECHR) and the Court of Justice of the European Union(CJEU) in relation to their roles and functions?
options: ECHR can rule on issues concerning privacy as a fundamental right, while the CJEU cannot.
CJEU can force national governments to implement and honor EU law, while the ECHR cannot.
CJEU can hear appeals on human rights decisions made by national courts, while the ECHR cannot
ECHR can enforce human rights laws against governments that fail to implement them, while the CJEU cannot.
explanation: 欧洲人权法院(ECHR)主要负责保护欧洲人权公约规定的人权，而欧洲联盟法院(CJEU)的主 要责任是确保欧盟法律的解释和应用的统一性。差别在于，CJEU 有权强制国家政府执行和 尊重欧盟法，而ECHR 没有这种权力。

scenario:
SCENARIO(5-7)
Please use the following to answer the next question:
Anna and Frank both work at Granchester University. Anna is a lawyer responsible for data protection, while Frank is a lecturer in the engineering department. The University maintains a
number of types of records:
Student records, including names, student numbers, home addresses, pre-university information, university attendance and performance records, details of special educational needs and financial information.
Staff records, including autobiographical materials (such as curricula, professional contact files, student evaluations and other relevant teaching files).
Alumni records, including birthplaces, years of birth, dates of matriculation and conferrals of degrees. These records are available to former students after registering through Granchester's Alumni portal. Department for Education records, showing how certain demographic groups (such as first-generation students) could be expected, on average, to progress. These records do not contain names or identification numbers.
Under their security policy, the University encrypts all of its personal data records in transit and at rest.
In order to improve his teaching, Frank wants to investigate how his engineering students perform in relational to Department for Education expectations. He has attended one of Anna's data protection training courses and knows that he should use no more personal data than necessary to accomplish his goal. He creates a program that will only export some student data:previous schools attended, grades originally obtained, grades currently obtained and first time university attended. He wants to keep the records at the individual student level. Mindful of Anna's training, Frank runs the student numbers through an algorithm to transform them into different reference numbers. He uses the same algorithm on each occasion so that he can update each record over time.
One of Anna's tasks is to complete the record of processing activities, as required by the GDPR. After receiving her email reminder, as required by the GDPR. After receiving her email reminder, Frank informs Anna about his performance database.
Ann explains to Frank that, as well as minimizing personal data, the University has to check that this new use of existing data is permissible. She also suspects that, under the GDPR, a risk analysis may have to be carried out before the data processing can take place. Anna arranges to discuss this further with Frank after she has done some additional research.
Frank wants to be able to work on his analysis in his spare time, so he transfers it to his home laptop (which is not encrypted).Unfortunately, when Frank takes the laptop into the University he loses it on the train. Frank has to see Anna that day to discuss compatible processing. He knows that he needs to report security incidents, so he decides to tell Anna about his lost laptop at the same time.
question: Before Anna determines whether Frank's performance database is permissible, what additional information does she need?
options: More information about Frank's data protection training.
More information aboutthe extent of the information loss.
More information about the algorithm Frank used to mask student numbers.
More information about what students have been told and how the research will be used.
explanation: 根据 GDPR, 数据控制者需要对数据主体保持透明度，数据主体应被告知他们的数据将如 何，何时，何地以及出于何种目的被处理。

question: Anna will find that a risk analysis is NOT necessary in this situation as long as?
options: The data subjects are no longer current students of Frank's
The processing will not negatively affect the rights of the data subjects
The algorithms that Frank uses for the processing are technologically sound
The data subjects gave their unambiguous consent for the original processing
explanation: 风险分析是识别、评估和减轻可能影响组织个人数据处理活动的潜在威胁和漏洞的过程。 风险分析不是一次性活动。但风险分析是一个持续、动态的过程，需要定期监控和更新， 它也不能替代 GDPR 合规性，而是通过识别和解决法律义务和最佳实践来帮助确保合规性 的工具。根据GDPR, 组织必须在开始任何可能对数据主体的权利和自由构成高风险的新 的或显着增加的处理活动之前进行数据保护影响评估(DPIA)。 在考虑是否需要进行风险评 估时，需要重点关注的是处理活动是否可能对数据主体的权利和自由产生风险。

GDPR Articles 24-39 - Controller and Processor Obligations

Article 24: Responsibility of the controller
Article 25: Data protection by design and by default
Article 30: Records of processing activities
Article 32: Security of processing
Article 35: Data protection impact assessment (DPIA)
Article 37: Designation of the data protection officer (DPO)
Article 39: Tasks of the data protection officer

---

GDPR Article 35 - Data protection impact assessment

1. Where processing is likely to result in a high risk to the rights and freedoms of natural persons, the controller shall carry out an assessment of the impact of the envisaged processing operations (DPIA).

3. A DPIA is required in particular in case of:
(a) systematic and extensive evaluation based on automated processing;
(b) processing on a large scale of special categories of data;
(c) systematic monitoring of a publicly accessible area on a large scale.

question: Which of the University's records does Anna NOT have to include in her record of processing activities?
options: Student records
Staff and alumni records
Frank's performance database
Department for Education records
explanation: 在处理活动记录中，Anna 不需要包括教育部的记录。GDPR 要求创建处理活动的记录，包 括数据主体的类别，数据的类别，接收者的类别，可能的数据转移，以及数据保留的期限 等信息。然而，这只适用于公司或机构处理的数据，而对于从其他机构(如教育部)收到 的统计数据可能并没有这样的要求，因为它们不包含个人可识别的信息。

question: What is true of both the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the Council of Europe Convention 108?
options: Both govern international transfers of personal data
Both govern the manual processing of personal data
Both only apply to European Union countries
Both require notification of processing activities to a supervisory authority
explanation: General Data Protection Regulation(GDPR)和 Council of Europe Convention 108(欧洲理事会 第108号公约)都规定了个人数据的国际转移。虽然它们的具体规定和应用范围可能有所 不同，但二者都确实在某种程度上规定了这一主题。

question: Which aspect of the GDPR will likely have the most impact on the consistent implementation of data protection laws throughout the European Union?
options: That it essentially functions as a one-stop shop mechanism
That it takes the form of a Regulation as opposed to a Directive
That it makes notification of large-scale data breaches mandatory
That it makes appointment of a data protection officer mandatory
explanation: GDPR 以法规的形式出现，而不是指令，这儿似乎对欧洲联盟内的数据保护法律的一致执 行影响最大。原因是法规在所有的欧洲联盟国家是直接适用的，不需要任何转化成为国内 法律。而指令则需要每个欧洲联盟成员国各自转化为国内法律，这就导致可能会有执行标 准的不一致。

question: What type of data lies beyond the scope of the General Data Protection Regulation?
options: Pseudonymized
Anonymized
Encrypted
Masked
explanation: 根据通用数据保护规定(GDPR), 已经被匿名化的数据是不在其覆盖范围内的。匿名化的数 据意味着数据经过处理以后，无法被用来识别个人。如果成功地完成匿名化，那么这些数 据就不再受到GDPR的制约。

question: Under what circumstances would the GDPR apply to personal data that exists in physical form, such as information contained in notebooks or hard copy files?
options: Only where the personal data is produced as a physical output of specific automated processing activities, such as printing, labelling, or stamping.
Only where the personal data is to be subjected to specific computerized processing, such as image scanning or optical character recognition.
Only where thepersonal data is treated by automated means in some way, such as computerized distribution or filing.
Only where the personal data is handled in a sufficiently structured manner so as to form part of a filing system.
explanation: 根据 GDPR, 只有当以物理形式存在的个人数据被以足够结构化的方式处理，以至于成为 文件系统的一部分时，GDPR 才会适用。也就是说，只要数据被组织在一个系统中，该系 统允许以特定标准(例如个人姓名、身份证号等)搜索特定的信息，无论是电子还是纸质 形式，都适用于GDPR。

scenario:
SCENARIO(12-15)
Please use the following to answer the next question:
You have just been hired by a toy manufacturer based in Hong Kong. The company sells a broad range of dolls, action figures and plush toys that can be found internationally in a wide variety of retail stores. Although the manufacturer has no offices outside Hong Kong and in fact does not employ any staff outside Hong Kong, it has entered into a number of local distribution contracts. The toys produced by the company can be found in all popular toy stores throughout Europe, the United States and Asia.A large portion of the company's revenue is due to international sales.
The company now wishes to launch a new range of connected toys, ones that can talk and interact with children. The CEO of the company is touting these toys as the next big thing, due to the increased possibilities offered:The figures can answer children's questions on various subjects, such as mathematical calculations or the weather. Each figure is equipped witha microphone and speaker and can connect to any smartphone or tablet via Bluetooth. Any mobile device within a 10-meter radius can connect to the toys via Bluetooth as well. The figures can also be associated with other figures(from the same manufacturer) and interact with each other for an enhanced play experience. When a child asks the toy a question, the request is sent to the cloud for analysis, and the answer is generated on cloud servers and sent back to the figure. The answer is given through the figure's integrated speakers, making it appear as though that the toy is actually responding to the child's question. The packaging of the toy does not provide technical details on how this works, nor does it mention that this feature requires an internet connection. The necessary data processing for this has been outsourced to a data center located in South Africa. However, your company has not yet revised its consumer-facing privacy policy to indicate this.
In parallel, the company is planning to introduce a new range of game systems through which consumers can play the characters they acquire in the course of playing the game. The system will
come bundled with a portal that includes a Near-Field Communications(NFC) reader. This device will read an RFID tag in the action figure, making the figure come to life onscreen. Each character has its own stock features and abilities, but it is also possible to earn additional ones by accomplishing game goals. The only information stored in the tag relates to the figures'abilities. It is easy to switch characters during the game, and it is possible to bring the figure to locations outside of the home and have the character's abilities remain intact.
question: What presents the BIGGEST potential privacy issue with the company's practices?
options: The NFC portal can read any data stored in the action figures
The information about the data processing involved has not been specified
The cloud service provider is in a country that has not been deemed adequate
The RFID tag in the action figures has the potential for misuse because of the toy's evolving capabilities
explanation: 根据描述，互动玩具中的数据要发送到云端进行分析，且答案由位于云端的服务器生成并 返回至玩具。但玩具包装并未提供关于如何操作的技术细节，也没有提到这一特性需要互 联网连接。公司将必要的数据处理外包给了位于南非的数据中心，但未在其面向消费者的 隐私策略中对此进行说明。这可能导致用户并不清楚他们的数据被怎样处理和使用。因此， 未能向消费者清晰透露他们的个人数据是如何被处理的可能构成最大的隐私问题。

The company's products are marketed directly to EU customers.

Include dual-factor authentication before each use by a child in order to ensure a minimum amount of security.
Include three-factor authentication before each use by a child in order to ensure the best level of security possible.
Insert contractual clauses into the contract between the toy manufacturer and the cloud service provider, since South Africa is outside the European Union.
explanation: 根据GDPR第32条有关数据处理安全性的要求，公司应实施的做法应为通过蓝牙无线连接 传输数据时加密数据。该条款对于数据的加密提出了明确的要求，以防止未经授权的访问 或与意料之外的数据泄露。因此，为确保儿童提出的问题以及其他可能涉及的个人数据在 传输过程中的安全，玩具制造商应对通过蓝牙传输的数据进行加密。

When a child asks the toy a question, the request is sent to the cloud for analysis, and the answer is generated on cloud servers and sent back to the figure. The answer is given through the figure's integrated speakers, making it appear as though that the toy is actually responding to the child's question. The packaging of the toy does not provide technical details on how this works, nor does it mention that this feature requires an internet connection. The necessary data processing for this has been outsourced to a data center located in South Africa. However, your company has not yet revised its consumer-facing privacy policy to indicate this.
In parallel, the company is planning to introduce a new range of game systems through which consumers can play the characters they acquire in the course of playing the game. The system will
come bundled with a portal that includes a Near-Field Communications(NFC) reader. This device will read an RFID tag in the action figure, making the figure come to life onscreen. Each character has its own stock features and abilities, but it is also possible to earn additional ones by accomplishing game goals. The only information stored in the tag relates to the figures'abilities. It is easy to switch characters during the game, and it is possible to bring the figure to locations outside of the home and have the character's abilities remain intact.
question: To ensure GDPR compliance, what should be the company's position on the issue of consent?
options: The child, as the user of the action figure, can provide consent himself, as long as no information is shared for marketing purposes.
Written authorization attesting to the responsible use of children's data would need to be obtained from the supervisory authority.
Consent for data collection is implied through the parent's purchase of the action figure for the child.
Parental consent for a child's use of the action figures would have to be obtained before anydata could be collected.
explanation: 为确保遵守 GDPR, 公司在获得同意的问题上的立场应为：在收集任何数据之前必须获得 父母对儿童使用动作人物的同意。根据GDPR的规定，如果一个儿童年龄在16岁以下，并 且企业正在处理他们的个人数据，那么必须获得父母或者法定监护人的同意。而企业在处 理儿童数据时，需要证明他们已经获取了有效的父母同意。这就意味着公司需要确保在动 作人物收集、传输或在云中处理任何数据之前，预先获得对儿童使用该玩具的父母同意。

question: Which of the following would most likely NOT be covered by the definition of“personal data” under the GDPR?
options: The payment card number of a Dutch citizen
The U.S.social security number of an American citizen living in France
The unlinked aggregated data used for statistical purposes by an Italian company
The identification numberof a German candidate fora professional examination in Germany
explanation: 根据 GDPR 的定义，“个人数据”是指与已识别或可识别的自然人(被称为“数据主体”)有 关的任何信息。当数据被汇总并用于统计目的，且无法链接到特定的个人时，这种类型的 数据通常不被视为“个人数据”。尽管原始数据集可能包含个人数据，但如果数据被适当地 匿名化并且不能精确地识别出特定的个人，那么这种数据就不再受GDPR 的保护。

question: Which of the following would MOST likely trigger the extraterritorial effect of the GDPR, as specified by Article 3?
options: The behavior of suspected terrorists being monitored by EU law enforcement bodies.
Personal data of EU citizens being processed by a controller or processor based outside the EU.
The behavior of EU citizens outside the EU being monitored by non-EU law enforcement bodies
Personal data of EU residents being processed by a non-EU business that targets EU customers.
explanation: 根据GDPR第3条的规定，最有可能触发GDPR 的域外效应的情况是：非欧盟企业处理的 目标是欧盟客户的欧盟居民的个人数据。第3条规定了GDPR 的应用范围，即使处理者或 控制者不在欧盟之内，只要他们的处理活动与提供给欧盟成员国境内的数据主体的商品或 服务相关，或者涉及对欧盟境内数据主体行为的监控，都将触发GDPR的规定。
legalReference: 相关法律条文引用待补充

question: What is the consequence if a processor makes an independent decision regarding the purposes and means of processing it carries out on behalf of a controller?
options: The controller will be liable to pay an administrative fine.
The processor will be liable to pay compensation to affected data subjects.
The processor will be considered to be a controller in respect of the processing concerned.
The controller will be required to demonstrate that the unauthorized processing negatively affected one or more of the parties involved.
explanation: 在 GDPR 的目的和框架内，处理者和控制者之间的区别是关键的，因为他们对数据保护的 责任和义务是不同的。如果处理者在没有控制者指示的情况下决定处理的目的和方式，那 么他们就会超越了处理者的角色并成为控制者，对此处理活动负有更大的责任。这也意味 着他们可能需要面临由于未能履行控制者义务而产生的法律后果。
legalReference: 相关法律条文引用待补充

question: Under which of the following conditions does the General Data Protection Regulation NOT apply to the processing of personal data?
options: When the personal data is processed only in non-electronic form.
When the personal data is collected and then pseudonymised by the controller.
When the personal data is held by the controller but not processed for further purposes.
When the personal data is processed by an individual only for their household activities.
explanation: 根据GDPR的规定，当个人数据仅用于个人的家庭活动时，它不适用。这是所谓的“家庭例 外”,其在GDPR 第 2 条 ( 2 )(c) 款中有明确规定。这意味着，如果个人仅在其个人生活 或家庭活动中处理个人数据，如个人的社交活动或家庭事务，那么这种情况下的数据处理 就不受GDPR 的规范。然而，使用在线平台向大众公开个人信息或进行有关其他人的数据 处理可能不能视为“纯家庭用途”,因此仍需遵守GDPR。
legalReference: 相关法律条文引用待补充

scenario:
SCENARIO(20-22)
Louis, a long-time customer of Bedrock Insurance, was involved in a minor car accident a few months ago. Although no one was hurt, Louis has been plagued by texts and calls from a company called Accidentable offering to help him recover compensation for personal injury. Louis has heard about insurance companies selling customers'data to third parties, and he's convinced that Accidentable must have gotten his information from Bedrock Insurance.
Louis has also been receiving an increased amount of marketing information from Bedrock, trying to sell him their full range of their insurance policies.
Perturbed by this, Louis has started looking at price comparison sites on the internet and has been shocked to find that other insurers offer much cheaper rates than Bedrock, eventhough he has been a loyal customer for many years. When his Bedrock policy comes up for renewal, he decides to switch to Zantrum Insurance.
In order to activate his new insurance policy, Louis needs to supply Zantrum with information about his No Claims bonus, his vehicle and his driving history. After researching his rights under the GDPR, he writes to ask Bedrock to transfer his information directly to Zantrum. He also takes this opportunity to ask Bedrock to stop using his personal data for marketing purposes.
Bedrock supplies Louis with a PDF and XML(Extensible Markup Language) versions of his No Claims Certificate, but tells Louis it cannot transfer his data directly to Zantrum as this is not technically feasible. Bedrock also explains that Louis's contract included a provision whereby Louis agreed that his data could be used for marketing purposes;according to Bedrock, it is too late for Louis to change his mind about this. It angers Louis when he recalls the wording of the contract, which was filled with legal jargon and very confusing.
In the meantime, Louis is still receiving unwanted calls from Accidentable Insurance. He writes to Accidentable to ask for the name of the organization that supplied his details to them. He warns Accidentable that he plans to complain to the data protection authority, because he thinks their company has been using his data unlawfully. His letter states that he does not want his data being used by them in any way
Accidentable's response letter confirms Louis's suspicions. Accidentable is Bedrock Insurance's wholly owned subsidiary, and they received information about Louis's accident from Bedrock shortly after Louis submitted his accident claim. Accidentable assures Louis that there has been no breach of the GDPR, as Louis's contract included, a provision in which he agreed to share his information with Bedrock's affiliates for business purposes.
Louis is disgusted by the way in which he has been treated by Bedrock, and writes to them insisting that all his information be erased from their computer system.
question: Which statement accurately summarizes Bedrock's obligation in regard to Louis's data portability request?
options: Bedrock does not have a duty to transfer Louis's data to Zantrum if doing so is legitimately not technically feasible.
Bedrock does not have to transfer Louis's data to Zantrum because the right to data portability does not apply where personal data are processed in order to carry out tasks in the public interest.

Bedrock has failed to comply with the duty to transfer Louis's data to Zantrum because the duty applies wherever personal data are processed by automated means and necessary for the performance of a contract with the customer.

Bedrock has failed to comply with the duty to transfer Louis's data to Zantrum because ithas an obligation to develop commonly used, machine-readable and interoperable formats so that all customer data can be ported to other insurers on request
explanation: 根据GDPR 第20条的规定，如果从技术上真正不可行的话，Bedrock 没有义务将Louis的 数据传输给Zantrum。数据携带权让数据主体有权要求将他们的个人数据从一家组织传输 到另一家组织，但这只在“技术上可行”的情况下才适用。Bedrock 已经提供给了Louis 他的 无赔款证明的 PDF 和 XML版本，他可以自行将这些信息提供给Zantrum 保险公司，因此 Bedrock已经满足了GDPR对数据携带权的要求。
legalReference: 相关法律条文引用待补充

question: Based on the GDPR's position on the use of personal data for direct marketing purposes, which of the following is true about Louis's rights as a data subject?
options: Louis does not have the right to object to the use of his data because he previously consented to it.
Louis has the right toobject at any time to theuse of his data and Bedrock must honor his request to cease use
Louis has the right to object to the use of his data, unless his data is required by Bedrock for the purpose of exercising a legal claim.
Louis does not have the right to object to the use of his data if Bedrock can demonstrate compelling legitimate grounds for the processing.
explanation: 根据GDPR第21条的规定，Louis随时都有权反对使用他的数据，Bedrock 必须尊重他停止 使用的请求。即使他之前同意了他的数据被用于直接营销，他仍有权随时撤回这个同意。 此外， 一旦数据主体反对个人数据的处理，数据控制者必须立即停止处理那些数据，除非 数据控制者能证明有迫切的合法理由来处理那些数据，且这些理由优于数据主体的权利和 自由，或者处理是为了建立、行使或者抗辩法律权利。然而在涉及直接营销的情况下，数 据主体有一个“绝对的权利”来反对他们的数据被用于这个目的。
legalReference:
ePrivacy Directive Article 13 - Unsolicited Communications

1. Use of automated calling systems, fax or email for direct marketing requires prior consent of subscribers.

2. 'Soft opt-in' exception: Where a company obtains email addresses from customers in the context of a sale, it may use those addresses for marketing similar products/services, provided customers are given clear opportunity to object at collection and in each message.

3. Member States may allow unsolicited calls with opt-out option (choice determined by national law).

4. Sending marketing emails that disguise sender identity or lack valid unsubscribe address is prohibited.

question: After Louis has exercised his right to restrict the use of his data, under what conditions would Accidentable have grounds for refusing to comply?
options: If Accidentable is entitled to use of the data as an affiliate of Bedrock.
If Accidentable also uses the data to conduct public health research.
If the data becomes necessary to defend Accidentable's legal rights.
If the accuracy of the data is not an aspect that Louis is disputing.
explanation: 根据GDPR 的规定，当个人数据被用于防御法律权利时，数据控制者可以继续处理数据， 即使数据主体已经行使了他对数据处理的限制权。这意味着，尽管Louis已经要求限制他的 个人数据的使用，但假如这些数据变得必要以防御 Accidentable 的法律权利的话， Accidentable 就有理由拒绝遵守 Louis 的请求。比如，如果 Louis 起诉 Accidentable, Accidentable可以使用Louis的信息以保护自己。

question: Under the GDPR, who would be LEAST likely to be allowed to engage in the collection, use, and disclosure of a data subject's sensitive medical information without the data subject's knowledge or consent?
options: A member of the judiciary involved in adjudicating a legal dispute involving the data subject and concerning the health of the data subject.
A public authority responsible for public health, where the sharing of such information is considered necessary for the protection of the general populace.
A health professional involved in the medical care for the data subject, where the data subject's life hinges on the timely dissemination of such information.
Ajournalist writing an article relating to the medical condition in question, who believes that the publication of such information is in the public interest.
explanation:
GDPR 将有关健康的数据定义为特殊类别的个人数据，受特定处理条件和保护措施的约束。 GDPR 禁止处理此类数据，除非第9条中的例外情况之一适用。这些例外之一是数据主体 的明确同意，这意味着数据主体已明确、肯定地表示同意处理其健康数据。另一个例外是 出于公共卫生领域公共利益的原因需要进行处理，例如防止对健康的严重跨境威胁或确保 医疗保健的高标准质量和安全。第三种例外是为了预防或职业医学、评估员工的工作能力、 医疗诊断、提供健康或社会护理或治疗或管理健康或社会护理系统而需要进行处理和服务。 这些例外是基于必要性原则，这意味着处理必须是为了特定目的而严格必要的，并且不能 通过其他方式实现。
在给定的情况下，记者不属于任何这些例外情况。记者不是卫生专业人员、公共机构或获 得数据主体明确同意的人。记者不会出于与公共卫生、医疗保健或社会保护相关的任何合 法目的处理数据。记者发表报道只是为了追求自己的利益，而报道可能符合也可能不符合 公众利益。

question: With the issue of consent, the GDPR allows member states some choice regarding what?
options: The mechanisms through which consent may be communicated
Thecircumstances in which silence or inactivity may constitute consent
The age at which children must be required to obtain parental consent
The timeframe in which data subjects are allowed to withdraw their consent
explanation: GDPR 规定，对于直接向儿童提供信息社会服务的情况，儿童年龄低于16岁，处理他们的 个人数据将需要得到其父母或法定监护人的同意。但是，GDPR 也允许各成员国通过立法 将这个年龄限制降低到13岁。

question: Which sentence BEST summarizes the concepts of“fairness,”“lawfulness”and“transparency”,as expressly required by Article 5 of the GDPR?
options: Fairness and transparency refer to the communication of key information before collecting data; lawfulness refers to compliance with government regulations.

Fairness refers to limiting the amount of data collected from individuals;lawfulness refers to the approval of company guidelines by the state;transparency solely relates to communication of key information before collecting data.
Fairness refers to the security of personal data;lawfulness and transparency refers to the analysis of ordinances to ensure they are uniformly enforced.
Fairness refers to the collection of data from diverse subjects;lawfulness refers to the need for legal rules to be uniform;transparency refers to giving individuals access to their data.
explanation: 根据GDPR 第5条的要求，数据应公正、透明地处理，数据主体需要清楚其个人数据如何 和为何被处理；“合法性”则要求所有数据处理活动都符合规定的法律依据。

question: A well-known video production company, based in Spain but specializing in documentaries filmed worldwide, has just finished recording several hours of footage featuring senior citizens in thestreets of Madrid. Under what condition would the company NOT be required to obtain the consent of everyone whose image they use for their documentary?
options: If obtaining consent is deemed to involve disproportionate effort.
If obtaining consent is deemed voluntary by local legislation.
If the company limits the footage to data subjects solely of legal age.
If the company's status as a documentary provider allows it to claim legitimate interest.
explanation: 如果该公司作为一个纪录片提供商，可以主张合法利益，那么它就不需要获得其纪录片中 使用的每个人的同意。根据 GDPR, 背景人物的图像可能会被视为个人数据，因此通常需 要他们的同意才能被使用。然而，如果公司可以证明他们公开这些图像以服务其合法利益， 而且这些利益比该名个人的隐私权重要，则可能不需要获得他们的同意。当然，这会依赖 于具体情况以及相应的数据保护主管部门的判断。

question: ASpanish electricity customer calls her local supplier with questions about the company's upcoming merger. Specifically, the customer wants to know the recipients to whom her personal data will be disclosed once the merger is final. According to Article 13 of the GDPR, what must the company do before providing the customer with the requested information?
options: Verify that the request is applicable to the data collected before the GDPR entered into force.
Verify that the purpose of the request from the customer is in line with the GDPR.
Verify that the personal data has not already been sent to the customer.
Verify that the identityof the customer can be proven by other means
explanation: 根据GDPR 第13条，公司在提供请求的信息之前，必须验证客户的身份。这是为了保护个 人数据，确保其不被错误地传递给未经授权的第三方。公司有责任采取一切必要措施，只 向正确的请求者(即数据主体)提供数据。如果公司对请求者的身份有任何疑问，他们应 该要求进一步的信息来确认其身份。其他选项并没有明确地要求在提供请求信息之前进行 验证。

question: Under the GDPR, where personal data is not obtained directly from the data subject, a controller is exempt from directly providing information about processing to the data subject if?
options: The data subject already has information regarding howhis data will be used.
The provision of such information to the data subject would be too problematic.
Third-party data would be disclosed by providing such information to the data subject.
The processing of the data subject's data is protected by appropriate technical measures.
explanation: 根据GDPR 第14条，如果个人数据并非直接从数据主体那里获得，那么如果数据主体已经 知道如何使用其数据，控制者就不需要直接向数据主体提供处理信息。原则上，数据主体 有权知道他们的数据如何被处理，包括数据收集来源，数据处理的方式等。然而，如果他 们已经拥有这些信息，那么就没有必要再次提供。

scenario:
SCENARIO(29-31)
Please use the following to answer the next question:
Due to rapidly expanding workforce, Company A has decided to outsource its payroll function to Company B.Company B is an established payroll service provider with a sizable client base and a solid reputation in the industry.
Company B's payroll solution for Company A relies on the collection of time and attendance data obtained via a biometric entry system installed in each of Company A's factories. Company B won't hold any biometric data itself, but the related data will be uploaded to Company B's UK servers and used to provide the payroll service. Company B's live systems will contain the following information for each of Company A's employees:
Name
Address
Date of Birth
Payroll number
National Insurance number
>Sick pay entitlement
Maternity/paternity pay entitlement
Holiday entitlement
Pension and benefits contributions
Trade union contributions
Jenny is the compliance officer at Company A.She first considers whether Company A needs to carry out a data protection impact assessment in relation to the new time and attendance system, but isn't sure whether or not this is required.
Jenny does know, however, that under the GDPR there must bea formal written agreement requiring Company B to use the time and attendance data only for the purpose of providing the payroll service, and to apply appropriate technical and organizational security measures for safeguarding the data. Jenny suggests that Company B obtain advice from its data protection officer. The company doesn't have a DPO but agrees, in the interest of finalizing the contract, to sign up for the provisions in full. Company Aenters into the contract.
Weeks later, while still under contract with Company A, Company B embarks upon a separate project meant to enhance the functionality of its payroll service, and engages Company C to help. Company C agrees to extract all personal data from Company B's live systems in order to create a new database for Company B.This database will be stored in a test environment hosted on Company C's U.S.server. The two companies agree not to include any data processing provisions in their services agreement, as data is only being used for IT testing purposes.
Unfortunately, Company C's U.S.server is only protected by an outdated IT security system, and suffers a cyber security incident soon after Company C begins work on the project. As a result, data relating to Company A's employees is visible to anyone visiting Company C's website. Company A is unaware of this until Jenny receives a letter from the supervisory authority in connection with the investigation that ensues. As soon as Jenny is made aware of the breach, she notifies all affected employees.
question: The GDPR requires sufficient guarantees of a company's ability to implement adequate technical and organizational measures. What would be the most realistic way that Company B could have fulfilled this requirement?
options: Hiring companies whose measures are consistent with recommendations of accrediting bodies.
Requesting advice and technical support from Company A's IT team.
Avoiding the use of another company's data to improve their own services.
Vetting companies'measures with the appropriate supervisory authority.

question: Assuming that the“without undue delay”provision is followed, what is the time limit for complying with a data access request?

question: WP29's“Guidelines on Personal data breach notification under Regulation 2016/679”provides examples of ways to communicate data breaches transparently. Which of the following was listed as a method that would NOT be effective for communicating a breach to data subjects?
options: A postal notification.
A direct electronic message
A notice on a corporate blog.
A prominent advertisement in print media.
explanation: 根据WP29 的《关于Regulation 2016/679下个人数据泄露通知的指南》,在数据主体之间透 明地通报数据泄露的有效方式，其中，并未列出在企业博客上发布公告为有效方法。在数 据泄露的情况下，企业通常需要采取更直接和个性化的通信方式，如邮件通知、直接电子 消息或打印媒体中的显著广告，这样才能确保信息能被数据主体正确、及时的接收。相反， 公司博客可能覆盖的受众范围过于广泛，而且不保证所有的数据主体都能看到信息，因此， 并没有被视为一种有效的通信方式。

GDPR Article 34 - Communication of a personal data breach to the data subject

1. When the personal data breach is likely to result in a high risk to the rights and freedoms of natural persons, the controller shall communicate the breach to the data subject without undue delay.

2. The communication shall describe the nature of the breach in clear and plain language and contain at least the information and measures referred to in Article 33(3)(b), (c) and (d).

question: Which of the following describes a mandatory requirement for a group of undertakings that wants to appoint a single data protection officer?

Together the companies drew up a series of marketing campaigns designed to highlight the environmental and economic
benefits of their products. After months of planning, Liem and EcoMick entered into a data sharing agreement to use the same marketing database, MarketIQ, to send the campaigns to their respective
contacts.
Liem and EcoMick also entered into a data processing agreement with MarketIQ, the terms of which included processing personal data only upon Liem and EcoMick's instructions, and making available to them all information necessary to demonstrate compliance with GDPR obligations.
Liem and EcoMick then procured the services of a company called JaphSoft, a marketing optimization firm that uses machine learning to help companies run successful campaigns. Clients provide JaphSoft with the personal data of individuals they would like to be targeted in each campaign. To ensure protection of its clients'data, JaphSoft implements the technical and organizational measures it deems appropriate. JaphSoft works to continually improve its machine learning models by analyzing the data it receives from its clients to determine the most successful
components of a successful campaign. JaphSoft then uses such models in providing services to its client-base. Since the models improve only over a period of time as more information is collected, JaphSoft does not have a deletion process for the data it receives from clients. However, to ensure compliance with data privacy rules, JaphSoft pseudonymizes the personal data by removing identifying information from the contact information. JaphSoft's engineers, however, maintain all contact information in the same database as the identifying information.
Under its agreement with Liem and EcoMick, JaphSoft received access to MarketIQ, which included contact information as well as prior purchase history for such contacts, to create campaigns that would result in the most views of the two companies'websites.A prior Liem customer, Ms. Iman, received a marketing campaign from JaphSoft regarding Liem's as well as EcoMick's latest products. question: Why would the consent provided by Ms. Iman NOT be considered valid in regard to JaphSoft?
options: She was not told which controller would be processing her personal data
She only viewed the visual representations of the privacy notice Liem provided.

explanation: 从情况中我们可以得知，虽然Iman 小姐同意接收关于 Liem 的产品的信息，但是她并没有 被告知JaphSoft 会处理她的个人数据，尤其是在关于 EcoMick 的营销活动中。此外，尽管 她可能已经同意了 Liem 和 EcoMick 之间的数据共享，但数据处理者的身份(在此例中为 JaphSoft) 没有被清晰地告知她，因此不符合GDPR 对明确同意的要求。

explanation: 根据GDPR 第32条和 WP 29在2018年2月发布的指南，公司Z 在发生这种突发的电力中 断，导致无法访问客户数据的情况下，应记录无法使用的事件，以展示其职责和透明性。 虽然数据的可用性丧失了一段时间，但并不表示数据遭到了非法访问或失窃，因此，不需 要通知受影响的个人或监管机构。在这种情况下，公司 Z 也应该评估其数据处理和安全措 施，以预防未来发生类似的情况。然而，这不一定要求他们进行全面的安全系统审计。

question: In addition to the European Commission, who can adopt standard contractual clauses, assuming that all required conditions are met?

The European Data Protection Supervisor.
explanation:

Zandelay Fashion('Zandelay') is a successful international online clothing retailer that employs approximately 650 people at its headquarters based in Dublin, Ireland. question: What would MOST effectively assist Zandelay in conducting their data protection impact assessment?
options: Information about DPIAs found in Articles 38 through 40 of the GDPR.
Data breach documentation that data controllers are required to maintain.
Existing DPIA guides published by local supervisory authorities.
Records of processing activities that data controllers are required to maintain.
explanation: 为了最有效地帮助 Zandelay进行数据保护影响评估(DPIA), 他们应参考当地监督机构发 布的现有 DPIA 指南。这些指南包括了对于处理活动可能对数据主体权利和自由产生的风 险的评估，相对应的风险缓解措施，以及在评估过程中可能涉及的各种问题和问题变量。 虽然 GDPR 的第38至40条，数据控制者必须维护的数据泄露文档，以及数据控制者必须 维护的处理活动记录等所有信息都对 DPIA 有一定的帮助，但是，当地监管机构发布的 DPIA指南通常会更加具体和详细，更能针对性地帮助Zandelay 进行有效的影响评估。

Please use the following to answer the next question:
Javier is a member of the fitness club EVERFIT. This company has branches in many EU member states, but for the purposes of the GDPR maintains its primary establishment in France. Javier lives in Newry, Northern Ireland (part of the U.K.),and commutes across the border to work in Dundalk, Ireland. Two years ago while on a business trip, Javier was photographed while working out at a branch of EVERFIT in Frankfurt, Germany. At the time, Javier gave his consent to being included in the photograph, since he was told that it would beused for promotional purposes only. Since then, the photograph has been used in the club's U.K.brochures, and it features in the landing page of its U.K.website. However, the fitness club has recently fallen into disrepute due to widespread mistreatment of members at various branches of the club in several EU member states. As a result, Javier no longer feels comfortable with his photograph being publicly associated with the fitness club.
After numerous failed attempts to book an appointment with the manager of the local branch to discuss this matter, Javier sends a letter to EVETFIT requesting that his image be removed from the website and all promotional materials. Monthspass and Javier, having received no acknowledgment of his request, becomes very anxious about this matter. After repeatedly failing to contact EVETFIT through alternate channels, he decides to take action against the company.
Javier contacts the U.K.Information Commissioner's Office(ICO’-the U.K.'s supervisory authority) to lodge a complaint about this matter. The ICO, pursuant to Article 56(3) of the GDPR, informs the CNIL (i.e.the supervisory authority of EVERFIT's main establishment) about this matter. Despite the fact that EVERFIT has an establishment in the U.K.,the CNIL decides to handle the case in accordance with Article 60 of the GDPR. The CNIL liaises with the ICO, as relevant under the cooperation procedure. In light of issues amongst the supervisory authorities to reach a decision, the European Data Protection Board becomes involved and, pursuant to the consistency mechanism, issues a binding decision.
Additionally, Javier sues EVERFIT for the damages caused as a result of its failure to honor his request to have his photograph removed from the brochure and website.
question: Under the cooperation mechanism, what should the lead authority(the CNIL) do after it has formed its view on the matter?
options: Submit a draft decision to other supervisory authorities for their opinion.
Request that the other supervisory authorities provide the lead authority with a draft decision for its consideration.
Submit a draft decision directly to the Commission to ensure the effectiveness of the consistency mechanism.
Request that members of the seconding supervisory authority and the host supervisory authority co-draft a decision.
explanation:
根据GDPR 合作机制， 一旦牵头监管机构(本例中为CNIL, 法国数据保护机构)就当前 事项形成意见，就应起草一份决定草案并提交给其他相关监管机构，以收集他们的意见。 这一过程可确保所有相关的数据保护机构都有机会提供意见，并确保GDPR 在不同司法管 辖区的应用保持一致。
选项B 不正确，因为牵头监管机构是提出决定草案的机构，而不是从其他监管机构收到决 定草案的机构。
选项C 不正确，因为决定草案不是直接提交给欧盟委员会，而是提交给其他相关监管机构。 选项D 不正确，因为合作机制不涉及与次级监督机构和东道监督机构的成员共同起草决定。 相反，牵头监督机构起草决定，并与其他相关机构分享，征求他们的意见。

He will be able to sue any one of the relevant EVETFIT branches, as each one may be held liable for the entire damage.
He will have to sue each EVETFIT branch so that each branch provides proportionate compensation commensurate with its contribution to the damage or distress suffered by Javier.

explanation: 根 据GDPR 第82条规定，任何因违反GDPR 而遭受物质或非物质损害的人均有权就所遭受 的损失向控制者或处理者获得赔偿。参与处理的任何控制者应对违反GDPR 的处理造成的 损害承担责任。如果同一处理涉及多个控制者或处理者，或者控制者和处理者两者，并且 他们对处理造成的任何损害负责，则每个控制者或处理者应对全部损害承担责任，以确保 数据主体的有效补偿。

question: The GDPR specifies fines that may be levied against data controllers for certain infringements. Whichof the following infringements would be subject to the less severe administrative fine of up to 10 million euros (or in the case ofan undertaking, up to 2%of the total worldwide annual turnover of the preceding financial year)?
options: Failure to demonstrate that consent was given by the data subject to the processing of their personal data where it is used as the basis for processing.
Failure to implement technical and organizational measures to ensure data protection is enshrined by design and default.
Failure to process personal information in a manner compatible with its original purpose.
Failure to provide the means for a data subject to rectify inaccuracies in personal data.
explanation:
根据GDPR 第83条的规定，当公司未能实施技术和组织措施以确保数据保护原则被设计和 默认应用时，这可以被视为一个违规行为，并可能会受到最高达1000万欧元(或者在某个 企业的情况下，可能高达上一财年全球年营业额的2%)的罚款。这是因为 GDPR 强调了
“隐私设计”和“隐私默认”的重要性，这两个原则要求在任何与处理个人数据相关的活动 (包括产品和服务的设计阶段开始)中，都要尽可能提供最高级别的数据保护。

question: What is the MAIN reason GDPR Article 4(22) establishes the concept of the“concerned supervisory authority”?
options: To encourage the consistency of local data processing activity.
To give corporations a choice about who their supervisory authority will be.
To ensure the GDPR covers controllers that do not have an establishment in the EU but have a representative in a member state
To ensure that the interests of individuals residing outside the lead authority's jurisdiction are represented.
explanation: 根据GDPR 第4(22)条，如果出现以下情况，监管机构就会关注个人数据的处理：居住在 其成员国的数据主体受到或可能受到严重影响处理，或者是否已向其提出投诉。引入这个 概念主要是为了确保数据主体的权利和利益受到最接近他们的监管机构的保护，无论控制 者或处理者设立在何处，也无论主要监管机构位于何处。有关监管部门有权参与一站式服 务和一致性机制，并对牵头监管机构的决定草案表达意见和反对意见。他们还有义务在履 行职责时相互合作和协助任务。

options: Pursue a GDPR-compliant Privacy by Design process.

explanation:

(BYOD) 程序的关键部分，旨在确保员工在使用自己的设备进入公司网络或访问公司数 据时，能够保护公司数据的安全和隐私。

question: If a company is planning to use closed-circuit television(CCTV) on its premises and is concerned with GDPR compliance, it should first do all of the following EXCEPT?
options: Notify the appropriate data protection authority.
Perform a data protection impact assessment (DPIA).
Create an information retention policy for those who operate the system
Ensure that safeguards are inplace to prevent unauthorized access to the footage.
explanation:
根据GDPR, 在营业场所使用闭路电视涉及个人数据的处理，需要遵守数据保护原则和义 务。然而，通知适当的数据保护机构(DPA) 并不是公司在使用CCTV 之前应采取的步骤之 一，除非DPA有特别要求，或者CCTV 涉及需要事先咨询的高风险处理。为了确保GDPR 合规性，还需要采取其他步骤，如下所述：
执行数据保护影响评估(DPIA) 是任何可能对个人权利和自由造成高风险的处理类型的 强制性要求，例如对公共区域的大规模或系统监控。 DPIA 是一个帮助识别和减轻使 用闭路电视的潜在隐私风险，并记录为解决这些风险而采取的措施。 DPIA 应包括对 处理的描述、其目的和必要性、其风险和收益、保障措施和安全措施以及与利益相关 者的协商。应在安装或升级闭路电视系统之前进行 DPIA, 并定期或在处理过程发生 重大变化时进行审查。
为系统操作人员制定信息保留政策是一种良好的做法，可确保闭路电视收集的个人数 据的保留时间不会超过收集目的所需的时间，并且在不再使用时会被安全删除或匿名 化需要。保留期限应根据使用闭路电视的具体目的和背景来确定，并考虑任何法律或 合同义务以及数据主体的期望和权利。保留政策还应指定谁负责管理和删除闭路电视 录像，以及如何验证和记录删除过程。
确保采取保护措施来防止未经授权的视频访问，是遵守GDPR 完整性和保密性原则的 基本要求。该原则规定，个人数据的处理方式必须确保数据的适当安全性，包括防止 未经授权或非法处理以及意外丢失、毁坏或损坏。保障措施可能包括技术和组织措施， 例如加密、访问控制、日志记录、审计、培训、政策和程序，旨在保护闭路电视录像 在传输和传输过程中免遭未经授权或非法访问、披露、更改或破坏。

Building Block Inc.is a multinational company, headquartered in Chicago with offices throughout the United States, Asia, and Europe (including Germany, Italy, France and Portugal).Last year the company was the victim of a phishing attack that resulted in a significant data breach. The executive board, in coordination with the general manager, their Privacy Office and the Information Security team, resolved to adopt additional security measures. These included training awareness programs,
a cybersecurity audit, and use of a new software tool called SecurityScan, which scans employees' computers to see if they have software that is no longer being supported by a vendor and therefore not getting security updates. However, this software also provides other features, including the monitoring of employees'computers.
Since these measures would potentially impact employees, Building Block's Privacy Office decided to issue a general notice to all employees indicating that the company will implement a series of
initiatives to enhance information security and prevent future data breaches.
After the implementation of these measures, server performance decreased. The general manager instructed the Security team on how to use SecurityScan to monitor employees'computers activity and their location. During these activities, the Information Security team discovered that one employee from Italy was daily connecting to a video library of movies, and another one from Germany worked remotely without authorization. The Security team reported these incidents to the Privacy Office and the general manager. In theirreport, the team concluded that the employee from Italy was the reason why the server performance decreased.
Due to the seriousness of these infringements, the company decided to apply disciplinary measures to both employees, since the security and privacy policy of the company prohibited employees from installing software on the company's computers, and from working remotely without authorization.
question: What would be the MOST APPROPRIATE way for Building Block to handle the situation with the employee from Italy?
options: Since the GDPR does not apply to this situation, the company would be entitled to apply any disciplinary measure authorized under Italian labor law.

a cybersecurity audit, and use of a new software tool called SecurityScan, which scans employees' computers to see if they have software that is no longer being supported by a vendor and therefore not getting security updates. However, this software also provides other features, including the monitoring of employees'computers.
Since these measures would potentially impact employees, Building Block's Privacy Office decided to issue a general notice to all employees indicating that the company will implement a series of
initiatives to enhance information security and prevent future data breaches.
After the implementation of these measures, server performance decreased. The general manager instructed the Security team on how to use SecurityScan to monitor employees'computers activity and their location. During these activities, the Information Security team discovered that one employee from Italy was daily connecting to a video library of movies, and another one from Germany worked remotely without authorization. The Security team reported these incidents to the Privacy Office and the general manager. In theirreport, the team concluded that the employee from Italy was the reason why the server performance decreased.
Due to the seriousness of these infringements, the company decided to apply disciplinary measures to both employees, since the security and privacy policy of the company prohibited employees from installing software on the company's computers, and from working remotely without authorization.
question: In addition to notifying employees about the purpose of the monitoring, the potential uses of their data and their privacy rights, what information should Building Block have provided them before implementing the security measures?
options: Information about what is specified in the employment contract.
Information about who employees should contact with any queries.
Information about how providing consent could affect them as employees.
Information about how the measures are in the best interests of the company
explanation: 当公司打算实施新的安全措施时，除了通知员工关于监控的目的、数据的潜在用途以及他 们的隐私权利外，公司还需要给他们提供到底应该去联系谁以便在实施过程中提出问题或 者获取更多的信息。这是因为，在了解了将要实施的措施之后，员工可能会对其产生疑惑， 或者在日后的实施过程中会有问题需要解答，向他们提供一个可联系的信息窗口可以帮助 他们更好地理解这些措施，也可以确保整个过程的透明度和公正性。
legalReference:
European Convention on Human Rights - Article 8

Article 8 - Right to respect for private and family life

1. Everyone has the right to respect for his private and family life, his home and his correspondence.

2. There shall be no interference by a public authority with the exercise of this right except such as is in accordance with the law and is necessary in a democratic society in the interests of national security, public safety, economic well-being, prevention of disorder or crime, protection of health or morals, or protection of rights and freedoms of others.

The right to privacy under Article 8 is NOT absolute - it must be balanced against other rights through a three-stage test: legitimate aim, necessary measures, proportionality.

question: In which of the following cases would an organization MOST LIKELY be required to follow both ePrivacy and data protection rules?
options: When creating an untargeted pop-up ad on a website.
When calling a potential customer to notify her of an upcoming product sale.
When emailing a customer to announce that his recent order should arrive earlier than expected.
When paying a search engine company to give prominence to certain products and services within specific search results.
explanation:
在某些情况下，组织可能需要同时遵守 ePrivacy 和数据保护规则。例如，在向搜索引擎公 司支付费用，以在特定搜索结果中突出显示其产品和服务的情况下，这需要处理个人数据
(如搜索历史、地理位置等)以个性化搜索结果，同时也可能涉及到cookies的使用，这既 涉及到数据保护规则(GDPR), 也涉及到电子隐私指令(ePrivacy) 。因此，该组织最有可 能需要同时遵守ePrivacy和数据保护规则。

question: A mobile device application that uses cookies will be subject to the consent requirement of which of the following?
options: The ePrivacy Directive.
The E-Commerce Directive.
The Data Retention Directive.
The EU Cybersecurity Directive.
explanation: 《电子隐私指令》,也称为《Cookie 法》,是规范Cookie 使用的欧盟立法以及网站和移动 应用程序上的其他跟踪技术。电子隐私指令规定，使用网站和移动应用程序上的 cookie 须 事先征得用户同意，除非Cookie 是提供服务所必需的。还必须向用户提供明确且有关 cookie用途和拒绝cookie 方法的全面信息。电子隐私该指令是对GDPR的补充，GDPR 也 适用于通过cookie 处理个人数据，但是没有具体解决cookie 的同意要求。其他答案选项与 以下内容无关Cookie的同意要求，因为它们规范数字经济和社会的不同方面。电子商务指 令建立了欧盟在线服务的法律框架，例如信息社会服务、电子合同和中介机构的责任。数 据保留指令要求电信提供商出于执法目的将某些数据保留一段时间国家安全。欧盟网络安 全指令旨在增强网络和信息安全整个欧盟的系统，通过为基本服务和运营商制定共同标准 和义务数字服务提供商。

question: What term BESTdescribes the European model for data protection?
options: Sectoral.
Self-regulatory.
Market-based.
Comprehensive.
explanation: 欧洲数据保护模式最好被描述为全面，因为它涵盖了数据处理的所有部门和类型，并且适 用于针对或收集与欧盟境内人员相关的数据的任何组织。 GDPR 是该模式的主要法律文书， 它建立了一套数据保护的原则、权利和义务，以及欧盟成员国和数据保护机构之间执行和 合作的统一框架，GDPR 还确保与其他欧盟法律和政策(例如电子隐私指令)的一致性。
legalReference: 相关法律条文引用待补充

question: What is a reason the European Court of Justice declared the Data Retention Directive invalid in 2014?
options: The requirements affected individuals without exception.
The requirements were financially burdensome to EU businesses.
The requirements specified that data must be held within the EU.
The requirements had limitations on how national authorities could use data.
explanation:
《数据保留指令》是一项欧盟法律，要求电子通信服务提供商将某些数据(如流量和位置 数据)保留六个月至两年，以预防、调查、侦查和起诉严重犯罪。然而，2014年，欧盟法 院宣布该指令无效，因为它违反了《欧盟基本权利宪章》中规定的尊重私人生活和保护个 人数据的基本权利。法院认为，该指令对这些权利造成了广泛和特别严重的干涉，而不限 于严格必要的干涉。得出这一结论的原因之一是，该指令适用于所有个人、所有电子通信 手段和所有通信数据，没有任何区别、限制或例外，因此影响到欧盟的所有人口。法院还
指出，该指令没有提供足够的保障措施，以确保有效保护数据免受滥用和非法获取的风险， 也没有要求数据必须保留在欧盟境内。
legalReference: 相关法律条文引用待补充

question: Which of the following entities would most likely be exempt from complying with the GDPR?
options: A South American company that regularly collects European customers'personal data
A company that stores all customer data in Australia and is headquartered in a European Union (EU) member state.
A Chinese company that has opened a satellite office in a European Union (EU) member state to service European customers.
ANorth American company servicing customers in South Africa that uses a cloud storage system made by a European company
explanation: 最有可能免于遵守 GDPR 的是一家在南非提供服务的北美公司，该公司使用欧洲公司制造 的云存储系统。这是因为 GDPR 主要适用于处理欧盟公民数据的公司，无论这些公司是否 在欧洲。在这个选项中，该公司处理的是南非客户的数据，因此，如果他们没有处理来自 欧洲公民的个人数据，他们将不必遵守GDPR。
legalReference: 相关法律条文引用待补充

question: When does the GDPR provide more latitude for a company to process data beyond its original collection purpose?
options: When the data hasbeen pseudonymized.
When the data is protected by technological safeguards.
When the data serves legitimate interest of third parties.
When the data subject has failed to use a provided opt-out mechanism.
explanation:
GDPR 对公司进一步处理数据提供了更大的灵活性，这是在数据已经被假名化的情况下。 如果正确进行了假名化，这些数据可以用于其原始收集目的之外的其他合法目的，因为这 样可以减少对数据主体隐私的影响。
补充：答案已核实，依据：GDPR recital 29
legalReference: 相关法律条文引用待补充

question: In which situation would a data controller most likely be able to justify the processing of the data of a child without parental consent?
options: When the data is to be processed for market research.
When providing preventive or counselling services to the child.
When providing the child with materials purely for educational use.
When a legitimate business interest makes obtaining consent impractical.
explanation:
如有必要，未经父母同意处理儿童的个人数据可能是合法的，例如健康、教育、社会或法 律服务，直接提供给儿童并旨在保护儿童的福祉、安全、发展或权利。例如，这可能包括 在线咨询平台、性健康建议服务、反欺凌或心理健康支持服务，或儿童保护热线。在这种
情况下，数据控制者应确保处理过程公平、透明、相称并尊重儿童的最大利益，并采取适 当的保障措施来保护儿童的个人数据和权利。
补充：答案已核实，依据是GDPR recital 38，“The consent of the holder of parental responsibility should not be necessary in the context of preventive or counselling services offered directly to a child.”

question: According to the GDPR, when should the processing of photographs be considered processing of special categories of personal data?
options: When processed with the intent to publish information regarding a natural person on publicly accessible media.
When processed with the intent to proceed to scientific or historical research projects.
When processed with the intent to uniquely identify or authenticate a natural person
When processed with the intent to comply with a law.
explanation: 根据 GDPR, 当处理的目的是确切地识别或认证一个自然人时，照片的处理应被视为处理 特殊类别的个人数据。这是因为借助照片， 一名个体可以被清晰地、几乎独一无二地识别 出来，因此这种情况下的图片处理被看作是敏感信息的处理。
legalReference: 相关法律条文引用待补充

question: The GDPR requires controllers to supply data subjects with detailed information about the processing of their data. Where a controller obtains data directly from data subjects, which of the following items of information does NOT legally have to be supplied?
options: The recipients or categories of recipients.
The categories of personal data concerned.
The rights of access, erasure, restriction, and portability
The right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority.
explanation:
根据GDPR 第13条，如果控制者直接从数据主体获取数据，他们不需要法律上提供有关涉 及的个人数据类别的信息。因为数据主体是直接提供这些数据，他们已经知道或者可以知 道这些信息是关于哪些个人数据的。然而，其他所有信息：接收者或接收者类别，访问权、 删除权、限制权和携带权，以及向监管机构提出投诉的权利，都是必须提供的。
补充：答案已核实，第十四条规定的告知内容比第十三条多“the categories of personal data concerned;”
legalReference: 相关法律条文引用待补充

question: Under Article 30 of the GDPR, controllers are required to keep records of all of the following EXCEPT?
options: Incidents of personal data breaches, whether disclosed or not.
Data inventory or data mapping exercises that have been conducted.
Categories of recipients to whom the personal data have been disclosed.
Retention periods for erasure and deletion of categories ofpersonal data.
explanation:
GDPR 第30条并不要求数据控制者记录所有个人数据违规的事件。此类要求包含在GDPR 的第33条和第34条，分别处理向监管机构通报个人数据违规和向数据主体通报个人数据
违规。另一方面，第30条更关注数据控制者和处理者的一般记录保存要求，包括处理活动 的数据类别、数据接收者、数据传输、保存期限，以及保障数据安全的措施。

question: Which mechanism, new to the GDPR, now allows for the possibility of personal data transfers to third countries under Article 42?
options: Approved certifications
Binding corporate rules.
Law enforcement requests.
Standard contractual clauses
explanation: 根据GDPR 第42条，委员会可以批准认证机制、印章和标记，以证明存在针对向第三国或 国际组织传输个人数据的适当保障措施。这些认证机制、印章和标志是自愿且透明的，由 认可的认证机构或主管监管机构颁发。它们须遵守GDPR 第42条和第43条中关于认证的 一般规定。它们的目的是增强数据主体的信任，并促进个人数据在欧盟内外的自由流动。 如果不满足或不再满足认证条件，它们还将受到定期审查、撤销或暂停。
legalReference: 相关法律条文引用待补充

question: With respect to international transfers of personal data, the European Data Protection Board (EDPB) confirmed that derogations may be relied upon under what condition?
options: If the data controller has received preapproval from a Data Protection Authority (DPA),after submitting the appropriate documents.
When it has been determined that adequate protection can be performed
Only if the Data Protection Impact Assessment (DPIA) shows low risk.
Only as a last resort and when interpreted restrictively.
explanation: 当无法基于充分性决定、适当的保护措施或具有约束力的公司规则将个人数据传输到第三 国或国际组织时，GDPR 允许在特定情况下进行减损。然而，这些减损是一般规则的例外， 不应成为常态。 EDPB 确认，减损仅应作为最后手段，并在进行限制性解释时使用，同时 考虑到数据的性质、处理的目的和持续时间、来源国和目的地国以及数据主体的权利和自 由 。EDPB 还强调，数据出口方必须评估第三国的保护水平，并确保传输不会损害数据主 体基本权利和自由的本质。

question: Which of the following is T-Craze's lead supervisory authority?
options: Germany, because that is where T-Craze is headquartered.
France, because that is where T-Craze conducts processing of personal information.
Spain, because that is T-Craze's primary market based on its marketing campaigns.
T-Craze may choose its lead supervisory authority where any of its affiliates are based, because ithas presence in several European countries.
explanation:
根据《通用数据保护条例》(GDPR), 要确定主要监管权机构， 一般需要考虑哪个地方是 组织的“主要建立”。对于 T-Craze, 这将是其总部所在地，即德国。虽然其营销和销售活动 由法国子公司负责，但总部和主要产品设计部门仍在德国。

Many businesses print their employees'photographs on building passes, so that employees can be identified by security staff. This is notwithstanding the fact that facial images potentially qualify as biometric data under the GDPR. Why would such practice be permitted?

question: A company in France suffers a robbery over the weekend owing to a faulty alarm system. When it is determined that the break-in involves the loss of a substantial amount of data, the company decides on a CCTV system to monitor for future incidents. Company technicians install cameras in the entrance of the building, hallways and offices. Footage is recorded continuously, and is monitored by the home office in the United States. What is the most realistic step the company could take to address their security concerns and comply with the personal data processing principles set out in Article 5 of the GDPR?
options: Seek informed consent from company employees
Have cameras recording during work hoursonly.
Retain captured footage for no more than 30 days.
Restrict camera placement to building entrances only
explanation:
根据GDPR 第5条，处理个人数据的方式必须确保个人数据的适当安全性，包括使用适当 的技术或组织措施("完整性和保密性")防止未经授权或非法处理以及防止意外丢失、毁 坏或损坏。公司在大楼入口、走廊和办公室安装摄像头的决定可能违反这一原则，因为这 可能使员工和访客的个人数据面临不必要的风险，如黑客攻击、滥用或泄露。此外，公司 还必须遵守数据处理的其他原则，如合法性、公平性和透明度、目的限制、数据最小化、
准确性和存储限制。公司安装摄像头必须有合法和具体的目的，并且必须告知数据当事人 其个人数据的处理情况。公司还必须确保摄像头只收集目的所需的最低数量的数据，并确 保数据的准确性和保存时间不超过必要的时间。公司还必须尊重数据当事人的权利和自由， 并为他们提供行使权利的途径，如查阅、更正、删除、限制、反对或移植的权利。
该公司为解决安全问题并遵守GDPR 第5条规定的个人数据处理原则，可以采取的最现实 的措施是将摄像头的放置范围限制在大楼入口处。这将限制数据处理的范围和影响，降低 员工和访客个人数据的风险。公司仍需将处理过程告知数据主体，并确保录像的安全存储 和传输，尤其是在由美国总部监控的情况下，因为美国是第三国，可能无法为个人数据提
供足够的保护。公司还需要考虑是否有可能获得数据主体的同意，或依据其他法律依据进 行处理，如公司的合法利益或合同的履行。A 选项是GDPR第6条的事情。

question: Which of the following is an example of direct marketing that would be subject to European data protection laws?
options: An updated privacy notice sent to an individual's personal email address.
A charity fundraising event notice sent to an individual at her business address.
A service outage notification provided to an individual by recorded telephone message.
A revision of contract terms conveyed to an individual by SMS from a marketing organization.
explanation: 1.1 Concept of direct marketing Not all communications from a business – even a marketing business – are considered direct marketing. The Article 29 Working Party (WP29) has provided guidance on the scope of the term ‘direct marketing’ and considers it to include any form of sales promotion, even including direct marketing by charities and political organisations (e.g., for fundraising purposes).³ However, the direct marketing message does not need to offer something for sale; it could be a promotion of a free offer or of the sender’s organisation in some way – the definition of marketing is broad.
legalReference:
ePrivacy Directive Article 13 - Unsolicited Communications

1. Use of automated calling systems, fax or email for direct marketing requires prior consent of subscribers.

2. 'Soft opt-in' exception: Where a company obtains email addresses from customers in the context of a sale, it may use those addresses for marketing similar products/services, provided customers are given clear opportunity to object at collection and in each message.

3. Member States may allow unsolicited calls with opt-out option (choice determined by national law).

4. Sending marketing emails that disguise sender identity or lack valid unsubscribe address is prohibited.

question: Which marketing-related activity is least likely to be covered by the provisions of Privacy and Electronic Communications Regulations (Directive 2002/58/EC)?
options: Advertisements passively displayed on a website.
The use of cookies to collect data about an individual.
A text message to individuals from a company offering concert tickets for sale.
An email from a retail outlet promoting a sale to one of their previous customer
explanation:
隐私和电子通信条例(PECR) 源自电子隐私指令2002/58/EC,旨在保护电子通信用户的隐 私和机密性服务。PECR 涵盖电子营销的各个方面，例如 cookie 的使用、主动提供的通信、 交通和位置数据。根据 PECR, 以下与营销相关的活动需要用户或订阅者的同意，除非适 用某些豁免：
> 使用cookie 或类似技术来存储或访问用户设备上的信息(第6条)。
出于直接营销目的向尚未订阅的个人订阅者发送电子邮件事先征得他们的同意(第22 条)。
出于直接营销目的向已订阅的个人用户主动拨打电话在电话偏好服务中注册了电话号 码或拒绝拨打此类电话的人特定呼叫者(规则21)。
>通过电子邮件发送未经请求的通信以用于直接营销目的，向企业订户发送传真或自动 呼叫系统，除非他们表明不这样做希望收到此类通讯(第23条)。
因此，在这四种选择中，最不可能被 PECR 条款涵盖的一种是被动显示在网站上的广告， 因为它们不涉及使用 cookie、发送未经请求的通信，或流量或位置数据的处理。然而，此 类广告可能如果涉及个人数据的处理，仍须遵守其他数据保护法，例如GDPR 用户的。
legalReference:
ePrivacy Directive - Directive 2002/58/EC

The ePrivacy Directive (2002/58/EC) regulates privacy and electronic communications in the EU.

Key provisions:
- Article 5: Confidentiality of communications and traffic data
- Article 6: Traffic data processing and billing
- Article 9: Location data processing
- Article 13: Unsolicited communications (spam)
- Article 15: Member States may restrict rights for public security

The Directive works alongside GDPR, providing specific rules for electronic communications sector.

question: When may browser settings be relied upon for the lawful application of cookies?
options: When a user rejects cookies that are strictly necessary
When users are aware of the ability to adjust their settings.
When users are provided with information about which cookies have been set.
When it is impossible to bypass the choices made by users in their browser settings.
explanation:
根据ICO 关于cookie 和类似技术、浏览器设置和其他使用的指南，只有满足以下条件，才 能依赖控制机制来合法应用cookie 状况：
> 它们旨在保护用户的隐私，并让他们能够控制cookie和类似技术；
它们突出且易于使用，并且不需要用户采取不必要的步骤或提供不必要的信息；
> 它们足够具体和细粒度，允许用户表达他们对不同类型和类型的偏好。Cookie 和类似
技术的目的；
他们充分了解并清楚将要设置或设置的cookie 和类似技术访问权限及其使用目的；
> 它们会定期进行审查和更新，以反映cookie 和类似技术的任何变化使用的内容或使用
的目的；
它们不会被可能干扰用户的其他软件或设置覆盖或规避选择；
它们提供了随时撤回同意的有效手段。
根据现有的欧洲法规，用户必须被告知他们有权利拒绝 cookie, 同时也有能力对其进行管 理和调整。所以，只有在用户明白如何以及何时他们可以在浏览器中更改自己的 cookie 设 置的情况下，才能视为对cookie应用的合法依据。选项D" 当用户在浏览器设置中做出的选 择无法被绕过时"也是一个理由，但是它更侧重于实行和强制，而不是通知和选择的自由。 法律规定，用户必须有充分的信息和自由选择权，才能做出知情的决定。因此，虽然用户 的选择不应被绕过是正确的，但在用户都可能不清楚他们对于 cookie 有选择权的情况下，
仅仅不能绕过他们的选择并不足以构成对 cookie的合法应用。因此B 更为合适。

The contract with the third-party advertising network.
The need to have the contents of the advertising approved.
explanation: 根据欧洲当前的隐私实践趋势，如果 Brady Box在欧洲建立公司，最可能存在不足的是在 线行为广告(OBA)的"A.选择加入的选项缺失"。现在越来越多的欧洲隐私规定要求获取用 户的明确同意才能对他们使用跟踪和行为广告等技术，因此提供用户主动选择加入的选项 变得至关重要。如果 Brady Box 只是通过第三方网络进行广告，而没有提供用户明确选择 加入或退出的选项，那么这部分就可能存在问题。

TripBliss Inc.is a travel service company which has lost substantial revenue overthelast few years. Their new manager, Oliver, suspects that this is partly due to the company's outdated website. After doing some research, he meets with a sales representative from the up-and-coming IT company Techiva, hoping that they can design a new, cutting-edge website for TripBliss Inc.'s foundering business.
During negotiations, a Techiva representative describes a plan for gathering more customer information through detailed questionnaires, which could be used to tailor their preferences to specific travel destinations. TripBliss Inc.can choose any number of data categories-age, income, ethnicity-that would help them best accomplish their goals. Oliver loves this idea, but would also like to have some way of gauging how successful this approach is, especially since the questionnaires will require customers to provide explicit consent to having their data collected. The Techiva representative suggests that they also run a program to analyze the new website's traffic, in order to get a better understanding of how customers are using it. He explains his plan to place a number of cookies on customer devices. The cookies will allow the company to collect IPaddresses and other information, such as the sites from which the customers came, how much time they spend on the TripBliss Inc.website, and which pages on the site they visit. All of this information will be compiled in log files, which Techiva will analyze by means of a special program. TripBliss Inc. would receive aggregate statistics to help them evaluate the website's effectiveness. Oliver enthusiastically engages Techiva for these services.
Techiva assigns the analytics portion of the project to longtime account manager Leon Santos. As is
standard practice, Leon is given administrator rights to TripBliss Inc.'s website, and can authorize access to the log files gathered from it. Unfortunately for TripBliss Inc.,however, Leon is taking on this new project at a time when his dissatisfaction with Techiva is at a high point. In order to take revenge for what he feels has been unfair treatment at the hands of the company, Leon asks his friend Fred, a hobby hacker, for help. Together they come up with the following plan:Fred will hack into Techiva's system and copy their log files onto a USB stick. Despite his initial intention to send the USB to the press and to the data protection authority in order to denounce Techiva, Leon experiences acrisis of conscience and ends up reconsidering his plan. He decides instead to securely wipe all the data from the USB stick and inform his manager that the company's system of access control must be reconsidered.
question: After Leon has informed his manager, what is Techiva's legal responsibility as a processor?
options: They must report it to TripBliss Inc.

explanation: 根据GDPR 第33条，处理者在意识到个人数据泄露后必须立即通知控制者。尽管莱昂和弗 雷德没有向其他任何人透露这些数据，但未经授权的访问和复制日志文件仍然构成个人数 据泄露。因此， Techiva 作为处理者，有法律责任向作为控制者的TripBliss Inc.报告。

ePrivacy Directive - Directive 2002/58/EC

The ePrivacy Directive (2002/58/EC) regulates privacy and electronic communications in the EU.

Key provisions:
- Article 5: Confidentiality of communications and traffic data
- Article 6: Traffic data processing and billing
- Article 9: Location data processing
- Article 13: Unsolicited communications (spam)
- Article 15: Member States may restrict rights for public security

The Directive works alongside GDPR, providing specific rules for electronic communications sector.

question: In which case would Natural Insight's use of BHealthy's data for improvement of its algorithms be considered data processor activity?
options: If Natural Insight uses BHealthy's data for improving price point predictions only for BHealthy.

explanation:
根据《一般数据保护条例》(GDPR), 数据处理者是代表数据控制者处理个人数据的自然 人或法人、机构、公共机关或任何其他机构。数据控制者是单独或与他人共同决定个人数 据处理目的和方式的自然人或法人、机构、公共机关或任何其他机构。GDPR 对数据控制 者和数据处理者都规定了具体的义务和责任，并要求他们签订书面合同或其他法律行为，
规定处理的主题、期限、性质和目的，以及数据控制者的义务和权利。在这种情况下，
BHealthy 是数据控制者，因为它决定了收集客户信息并与Natural Insight共享的目的和方式。 Natural Insight 是数据处理者，因为它代表BHealthy 处理客户信息，目的是确定BHealthy 新款防晒霜的价位。但是，Natural Insight 还打算将客户信息用于自己改进算法的目的，这 可能与BHealthy 的目的或指示不一致。这可能构成违反数据处理合同和GDPR 的行为，因 为数据处理者只能根据数据控制者的书面指示处理个人数据，除非欧盟或成员国法律要求
这样做 (GDPR 第28(3)(a)条)。
因此，Natural Insight将 BHealthy 的数据用于改进其算法被视为数据处理者活动的唯一情况 是 ，Natural Insight 收 到 BHealthy 的明确合同指示，将其数据用于改进其算法。这意味着 BHealthy 已同意并授权Natural Insight 为特定目的处理数据，并且Natural Insight 是按照 BHealthy的指示行事。在这种情况下， Natural Insight仍受数据处理合同和GDPR 的约束，
并必须遵守数据处理者的其他义务和要求，如确保数据安全、遵守雇用其他处理者的条件、 协助数据控制者确保遵守GDPR, 以及在服务结束后删除数据或将数据归还给数据控制者。 其他选项不属于数据处理者活动的有效情况，因为它们不涉及数据控制者的指示或同意。

question: Bioface is a company based in the United States. It has no servers, personnel or assets in the European Union. By collecting photographs from social media and other web-based services, such as newspapers and blogs, it uses machine learning to develop a facial recognition algorithm. The algorithm identifies individuals in photographs who are not in its data set based the algorithm and its existing data. The service collects photographs of data subjects in the European Union and will identify them if presented with their photographs. Bioface offers its service to government agencies and companies in the United States and Canada, but not to those in the European Union. Bioface does not offerthe service to individuals. Why is Bioface subject to the territorial scope of the General Data Protection Regulation?
options: It collects data from European Union websites, which constitutes an establishment in the European Union.
It offers services in the European Unionby identifying data subjects in the European Union.
It collects data from subjects and uses it for automated processing.
It monitors the behavior of data subjects in the European Union.
explanation: 一般数据保护条例(GDPR)的领土化条款规定，如果公司在欧盟境内监测数据主体的行为， 无论公司是否在欧盟境内，GDPR 都适用。在这种情况下，Bioface 通过收集欧盟数据主体 的照片，并且将在呈现他们的照片时识别他们，可以被理解为在监控欧盟内的数据主体行 为。因此，GDPR 适用于Bioface。

scenario:
SCENARIO(94-98)
Please use the following to answer the next question:
Joe started the Gummy Bear Company in 2000 from his home in Vermont, USA. Today, it is a multi- billion-dollar candy company operating in every continent. All of the company's IT servers are located in Vermont. This year Joe hires his son Ben to join the company and head up Project Big, which is a major marketing strategy to triple gross revenue in just 5 years. Ben graduated with a
PhD in computer software from a top university. Ben decided to join his father's company, but is also secretly working on launching a new global online dating website company called Ben Knows Best.
Ben is aware that the Gummy Bear Company has millions of customers and believes that many of them might also be interested in finding their perfect match. For Project Big, Ben redesigns the company's online web portal and requires customers in the European Union and elsewhere to provide additional personal information in order to remain a customer. Project Ben begins collecting data about customers'philosophical beliefs, political opinions and marital status.
Ifa customer identifies as single, Ben then copies all of that customer's personal data onto a separate database for Ben Knows Best. Ben believes that he is not doing anything wrong, because he explicitly asks each customer to give their consent by requiring them to check a box before accepting their information. As Project Big is an important project, the company also hires a first year college student named Sam, who is studying computer science to help Ben out.
Ben calls out and Sam comes across the Ben Knows Best database. Sam is planning on going to Ireland over Spring Beak with 10 of his friends, so he copies all of the customer information of people that reside in Ireland so that he and his friends can contact peoplewhen they are in Ireland.
Joe also hires his best friend's daughter, Alice, who just graduated from law school in the U.S.,to be the company's new General Counsel. Alicehas heard about the GDPR, so she does some research on it. Alice approaches Joe and informs him that she has drafted up Binding Corporate Rules for everyone in the company to follow, as it is important for the company to have in place a legal mechanism to transfer data internally from the company's operations in the European Union to the U.S.
Joe believes that Alice is doing a great job, and informs her that she will also be in-charge of handling a major lawsuit that has been brought against the company in federal court in the U.S.To prepare for the lawsuit, Alice instructs the company's IT department to make copies of the computer hard drives from the entire global sales team, including the European Union, and send everything to her so that she can review everyone's information. Alice believes that Joe will be happy that she did the first level review, as it will save the company a lot of money that would otherwise be paid to its outside law firm.
question: In preparing the company for its impending lawsuit, Alice's instruction to the company's IT Department violated Article 5 of the GDPR because the company failed to first do what?
options: Send out consent forms to all of its employees.
Minimize the amount of data collected for the lawsuit.
Inform all of its employees about the lawsuit.
Encrypt the data from all of its employees.
explanation: GDPR 第5条规定了与个人数据处理相关的原则，根据该条款，组织必须确保数据收集仅 限于与数据处理目的相关的必要范围——这就是所谓的数据最小化概念。因此，通过指示 IT 部门复制全球销售团队的所有硬盘，包括欧盟的硬盘，爱丽丝收集了大量数据，这可能 超出了诉讼的需要。更好的做法是只收集与诉讼直接相关且必要的数据，因此爱丽丝违反 了GDPR 的数据最小化原则。

question: The European Parliament jointly exercises legislative and budgetary functions with which of the following?

Sandy recently joined Market4U, an advertising technology company founded in 2016,as their VP of Privacy and Data Governance. question: A data controller appoints a data protection officer. Which of the following conditions would NOT result in an infringement of Articles 37 to 39 of the GDPR?

If the data protection officer is provided by the data processor
If the data protection officer also manages the marketing budget.
If the data protection officer receives instructions from the data controller.
explanation: 根据GDPR第37到39条，数据保护官员(DPO)并不需要拥有ISO 27001审计员认证。GDPR 要求 DPO 具备法律、IT 和数据保护方面的知识，但并未强制要求必须获得特定的认证。 DPO的主要职责是监督公司的数据保护策略和GDPR的合规性，而无须具备此类认证。

When all the information about Mike has been collected

question: Ifa French controller has a car-sharing app available only in Morocco, Algeria and Tunisia, but the data processing activities are carried out by the appointed processor in Spain, the GDPR will apply to the processing of the personal data so long as?

question: According to the European Data Protection Board, which of the following concepts or practices does NOT follow from the principles relating to the processing of personal data under EU data protection law?

Frequent pseudonymization key rotation.
Errorpropagation avoidance along the processing chain.

question: Which statement provides an accurate description of a directive?
options: A directive specifies certain results that must be achieved, but each member state is free to decide how to turn it into a national law.
A directive has binding legal force throughout every member state and enters into force on a set date in all the member states.
A directive is a legal act relating to specific cases and directed towards member states, companies or private individuals.
A directive is a legal act that applies automatically and uniformly to all EU countries as soon as it enters into force.
explanation: 指令 (Directive) 就是规定了必须达到的某些结果，但每个成员国可以自由决定如何将它 转化为国内法。其主要目标是调和欧盟内各成员国之间的法律，并在一定程度上保持各成 员国的立法自主性。
